div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of Thomas L. Thurston for a Writ of Habeas Corpus } No. 3128
RETURN TO PETITION FOR WRIT.

Comes now the respondent, O.P. Halligan, as Warden of the United States Penitentiary, McNeilisland, Washing- ton, and for answer and return to the petition of Thomas L. Thurston, filed herein, does affirm, deny and allege:
Respondent admits the allegations contained in para- graph one of the petition.
-II-

Respondent denies the allegations contained in para- graph two of the petition, that the petitioner is unlaw- fully detained and restrained of his liberty by the re- spondent herein, an alleges the true fact to be that the petitioner is now lawfully and rightly detained and re- strained of his liberty by the respondent, as an officer of the Department of Justice of the United States, to-wit, as Warden of the United States Penitentiary, at McNeil Island, washington, pursuant to and as a consequence of an indict- ment,arraignment plea of not guilty, trial, verdict, judgment, sent- ence and commitment had, in due and proper course in a crim- inal cause in the United States District Court for the Ter- ritory of Alaska, Fourth Judicial District, sitting at
Iditarod, Alaska, the same being cause No.44-1, wherein the United States was plantiff and Thomas L. Thurston and Agnes V. Thurston, were the defendants, and the said confinement and restraint by the respondent are in ac- ordance with and the result of the judgment entered in said cause.
-III-

The respondent admits the allegations contained in paragraph three of the petition, that said custody is by color of the authority of the United States, but denies that such custody is in violation of the consti- tution and laws of the United States
-IV-

The respondent in answer to the allegations con- tained in paragraph four, the respondent denies each and every allegation therein contained, except such as are hereinafter specifically admitted, and more particularly denied that the indictment and judgment filed and entered in said cause were pretended.

In further answer to the allegations of said para- graph, the respondent alleges that on or about the 23rd day of July, 1914, a legal and proper indictment was re- turned by a Grand Jury of the United States, duly and regularly qualified, impaneled and sworn, in the Fourth Judicial Division of the United States District Court, sitting at Iditarod, against the above named petitioner and one other defendant, charging the petitioner and his co-defendant with detaining, delaying and embezzling mail matter in violation of Section 195 of the Penal Code, and thereafter upon the appearance of said defendants, both in person and by counsel on arraignment, a plea of not guilty wa
entered by the petitioner and the other defendant there- in; thereafter, upon the issue so joined a jury was reg- ularly empaneled which returned its verdict into the court finding the petitioner and the other defendant, and each of them guilty under the allegations of the in- dictment and issues joined thereon; thereafter a judgment and sentence upon said verdict was duly and regularly en- tered by Hon. Charles E. Bunnell, trial judge of said court, a copy of which said judgment is hereto attached, marked exhibit "A" and made a part of this answer and return; that the said indictment,/arraignmentplea, verdict and judg- ment, and each of them, was entered in the docket of said court as a part of the proceedings in cause No.44-1 of the criminal causes of said court; that under the terms and conditions of the said judgment so entered, the marshal for said Division of the Territory of Alaska was required to deliver the body of the defendant, Thomas L. Thurston, to the warden of the United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island, Washington; that pursuant to the re- quirments of said judgment so entered, the said Marshal did, on the day of , 1915, deliver to this respondent at the United States Penitentiary the body of the petitioner, Thomas L. Thurston,and as a commitment and warrant for his said action delivered to this re- spondent under the seal of the Clerk of the District Court for the District of Alaska, Fourth Division, a certified copy of the judgment, hereinbefore referred to, a copy of which said certificate is hereto attached and made a part of this answer and return.

In answer to paragraph five of plantiff's petition, the respondent denies each and every material allegation therein contained, and more particulary denies that no proper or legal mittimus or other legal authority was de- livered to said respondent, and alleges that he isa hold- ing said prisoner by reason of the said judgment so en- tered, a certified copy thereof transmitted to him as a commitment in said action.
-VI-

In answer to paragraph six of the plantiff's peti- tion, respondent denies that the petitioner herein is not guilty of the crime herein charged against him and denies each and every material allegation contained in said para- graph six.

WHEREFORE, the respondent herein prays that the body of Thomas L. Thurston be remanded to and continue in the custody of this respondent as Warden of the United States Penitentiary; that said petitioner may be required to keep and preform the judgment and sentence entered in said criminal cause; that this action be dismissed with preju- dice; and for all further and proper relief in the premises.
Clay Allen
United States Attorney, for Respondent.
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING } ss.

Clay Allen, being first duly sworn, upon his oath de- poses and says; That he is United States Attorney for the Western District of Washington, and as such attorney is
familiar with the facts set forth in the foregoing answer and return; that he has read said answer and return and make this verification for and on behalf of the respond- ent, who is not now present; that each and all of the facts hereinbefore recited is set forth upon information and belief of this affiant, except the facts relative to the existence of the said judgment and certificate here- inbefore described; that the records hereinbefore referred to are in the Territory of Alaska, a remote distance from this District.
Clay Allen
Subscribed and sworn to before me and this 27th day of December, 1915.
Albert Woods Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
